thread.title: Georgia, Ole Miss, Texas A&M favored in Top 25 SEC showdowns
thread.title_full: Georgia, Ole Miss, Texas A&M favored in Top 25 SEC showdowns

author: Mike Herndon | mherndon@al.com
title: Georgia, Ole Miss, Texas A&M favored in Top 25 SEC showdowns
text:
Georgia, Ole Miss, Texas A&M favored in Top 25 SEC showdowns Nick Chubb, Skai Moore Georgia running back Nick Chubb (27) tries to break free from South Carolina linebacker Skai Moore (10) during the first half of an NCAA college football game in Athens, Ga. No. 13 Alabama takes on No. 8 Georgia on Saturday in Tuscaloosa. (AP Photo/John Bazemore, File) (John Bazemore) Comments 
Three matchups between Top 25 SEC teams are on the schedule this Saturday, and the home teams are favored in two of them. 
As of Friday morning, No. 8 Georgia (4-0) is a 2-point favorite at Sanford Stadium against No. 13 Alabama (3-1), according to lines set by oddsmaker Danny Sheridan -- the first time since the 2009 SEC championship game that Alabama enters a game as an underdog. 
In the other two games, No. 3 Ole Miss (4-0) is a 7-point favorite on the road at No. 25 Florida (4-0), and No. 14 Texas A&M (4-0) is a 6-point favorite at home against No. 21 Mississippi State (3-1). 
Sheridan's lines for Saturday's other SEC games, as of Friday morning: 
San Jose State at Auburn (-20) 
Arkansas at Tennessee (-6 1/2) 
South Carolina at Missouri (-3) 
Eastern Michigan at No. 9 LSU (-45 1/2) 
Vanderbilt at Middle Tennessee State (-2)
